name: NewYorker
text: “Some things punch you in the face and you ﬂy through the air and land somewhere completely diﬀerent,” Miranda July writes. “You walk on from there.” https://t.co/TFCUkpfUSC

name: NewYorker
text:
“The angel walked me to my door, quietly, dutifully, as if he had been sent there just to return me to safety.” Ottessa Moshfegh on the night she gave up drinking.

https://t.co/bJ5pGba09M

name: NewYorker
text:
"Friendships put you shoulder to shoulder to take on the world," Matthew Klam writes. But what if one friend breaks stride? 
https://t.co/JoKGLzwhU9
